section.title: Registering &rhla; with &rmt;
section.para: Use this procedure to register &rhel; &productnumber; with the &rmt; server.

listitem.para: The &rmt; server is running rmt-server version 2.10 or later.
The &reponame; &productnumber; repositories are available on the &rmt; server.
The system you want to register can access the &rmt; server.
The system you want to register is up to date. &productname; only supports the latest minor release of &rhla; &productnumber;.
You have a &productname; subscription activated in &scc;.
You have removed the system from any &rh; subscription services it was registered to.

step.para: On the &rhla; system, download the rmt-client-setup-res script:
Run the rmt-client-setup-res script with the URL of the &rmt; server as a parameter:
The script installs &suseconnect; and its dependencies, then downloads and runs the rmt-client-setup script, which performs the following tasks:

listitem.para: Imports the keys with gpg --import and rpm --import.
Downloads the CA certificate from https://RMT_SERVER/rmt.crt.
Imports the CA certificate to the trust store.

tip.para: To check whether the extension is available, run the &suseconnect; --list-extensions command.

step.para: The default repositories SLL-&productnumber;-Updates, SLL-AS-&productnumber;-Updates and SLL-CB-&productnumber;-Updates should be enabled. If you activated the &ha; extension, SLL-9-HA-Updates should also be enabled.

You will also see optional Source and Debug repositories with the status disabled. Be aware that these repositories are listed even if they are not mirrored on the &rmt; server. You can check the mirrored repositories by browsing the directory listing at https://RMT_SERVER/repo/SUSE/Updates/ or by logging in to the &rmt; server and running rmt-cli repos list.
